title: Microsoft Power BI vs Amundsen: Which analytics bi Tool is Better in 2026?
metaDescription: Compare Microsoft Power BI vs Amundsen. See pricing, features, pros & cons to choose the best analytics bi tool for your needs in 2026.
introduction: Choosing between Microsoft Power BI and Amundsen for your analytics bi needs? Both are popular tools in the AI space, but they have different strengths, pricing models, and use cases. This comprehensive comparison breaks down the key differences to help you make an informed decision.

sections.title: Overview: Microsoft Power BI vs Amundsen
paragraphs: Microsoft Power BI is Microsoft's business analytics platform that transforms data into actionable insights with interactive visualizations and reporting tools.. It's known for Microsoft, BI, Analytics.

Amundsen, on the other hand, is Amundsen is an open-source data discovery and metadata engine originally developed by Lyft. It provides a centralized search and catalog interface for data assets (tables, dashboards, streams) across an organization, enabling users to find, understand, and trust data. Its key capabilities include automated metadata ingestion, data lineage visualization, and usage-driven ranking, uniquely focusing on improving data productivity and reducing time spent searching for data.. Users choose it for data-catalog, metadata-management, data-lineage.

sections.title: Pricing Comparison
paragraphs: When it comes to value for money, consider your specific use case and team size. Microsoft Power BI offers a free tier, making it great for getting started.

sections.title: Features & Capabilities
paragraphs: Microsoft Power BI excels in: Data modeling, Interactive reports, Real-time dashboards. This makes it ideal for teams that need Microsoft.

Amundsen stands out with: Automated metadata ingestion from sources like Apache Atlas, AWS Glue, and databases, Search interface with ranking based on usage patterns (e.g., frequent queries, popularity), Column-level lineage tracking to visualize data flow and dependencies. It's particularly strong for users focused on data-catalog.

sections.title: Use Cases: When to Choose Each Tool
paragraphs: Choose Microsoft Power BI if: You need Microsoft, work with BI, or require flexible pricing.
Choose Amundsen if: You prioritize data-catalog, work in metadata-management, or prefer their pricing model.

sections.title: Pros & Cons
paragraphs: Microsoft Power BI Pros: Verified platform, Featured tool, Highly rated (4.6/5), Extensive feature set.
Microsoft Power BI Cons: Some limitations on free tier.
Amundsen Pros: Verified platform, Featured tool, Highly rated (4.4/5), Comprehensive features.
Amundsen Cons: May have feature limitations.

verdict: Both Microsoft Power BI and Amundsen are solid choices for analytics bi. Your choice depends on your specific requirements: Microsoft Power BI is better for Microsoft, while Amundsen excels at data-catalog. Consider trying both with their free tiers or trials to see which fits your workflow better.
